bibl.title: Underwater Archaeology in the Canopic region in Egypt: Geoarchaeology

series.title: Oxford Centre for Maritime Archaeology. Monograph

bibl.publisher: University of Oxford, Institute of Archaeology
bibl.note: P. xi: Andrew Wilson, Preface. - Chapter 1: J.-D.S., Geoarcheological exploration of submerged sites in Aboukir Bay, Egypt: an introduction. - Chapter 2: J.-D.S. & Andrew G. Warne, Nile Delta geography at the time of Heracleion and East Canopus. - Chapter 3: J.-D.S., Gérard Schnepp & Thomas Jorstad, Submergence of archaeological sites in Aboukir Bay, the result of gradual long-term processes plus catastrophic events. - Chapter 4: Maria Pia Bernasconi, Romana Melis, Nevio Pugliese & J.-D.S., Faunal analysis in the interpretation of the submergence of substrates beneath Heracleion. - Chapter 5: Th.J & J.-D.S., Vibracores in Aboukir Bay: description and analyses. - Appendix 1: Logs of Vibracores in Aboukir Bay. - Appendix 2: AMS dates from Aboukir Bay vibracores. - Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: Jean-Daniel Stanley (ed.), Underwater Archaeology in the Canopic region in Egypt: Geoarchaeology = Oxford Centre for Maritime Archaeology. Monograph 2.
Oxford, University of Oxford, Institute of Archaeology, 2007, 4°, xvi-128 pp., nombr. figg., cartes, pll. coul. ISBN 978-0-9549627-4-6. £50.

P. xi: Andrew Wilson, Preface. - Chapter 1: J.-D.S., Geoarcheological exploration of submerged sites in Aboukir Bay, Egypt: an introduction. - Chapter 2: J.-D.S. & Andrew G. Warne, Nile Delta geography at the time of Heracleion and East Canopus. - Chapter 3: J.-D.S., Gérard Schnepp & Thomas Jorstad, Submergence of archaeological sites in Aboukir Bay, the result of gradual long-term processes plus catastrophic events. - Chapter 4: Maria Pia Bernasconi, Romana Melis, Nevio Pugliese & J.-D.S., Faunal analysis in the interpretation of the submergence of substrates beneath Heracleion. - Chapter 5: Th.J & J.-D.S., Vibracores in Aboukir Bay: description and analyses. - Appendix 1: Logs of Vibracores in Aboukir Bay. - Appendix 2: AMS dates from Aboukir Bay vibracores. - Bibliography. Index.
Stanley Wilson Warne Schnepp Jorstad Bernasconi Melis Pugliese
